title: Applications to Write ISOs to USBs

fields.value:
[Get Rufus](http://rufus.akeo.ie/)
Slightly confusing UI, but reliable.  Only works on Windows.  Can also write Windows ISOs.  If you have issues booting a USB created with Rufus, be sure to try both ISO and dd modes.
fields.name: Rufus

fields.value:
[Get Etcher](https://github.com/balena-io/etcher/releases)
Easy to use with no install necessary.  Click 3 buttons and done.  Works on Linux, Windows, and macOS.
fields.name: Etcher

fields.value:
[Get ROSA Image Writer](http://wiki.rosalab.ru/en/index.php/ROSA_ImageWriter#Where_can_I_take_it.3F)
Easy to use with no install.  Just extract it, make it executable, and run it.  Click 3 buttons and done.  Recommended for use on Linux and macOS only as it sometimes has issues writing from Windows.
fields.name: ROSA Image Writer

fields.value: Unetbootin is ***not recommended***.  Unetbootin modifies the bootloader of the ISO as it is written, replacing it with a CD bootloader which usually doesn't work correctly with modern ISOs.
fields.name: Unetbootin
